isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - OUTPUT SHAFT (AUXILIARY MAIN SHAFT)

note.para: The output shaft is the same as the auxiliary main shaft. For the purpose of this manual, it will always be referred to as the output shaft.

step1.para: Use toolmaker's dye and mark one tooth on the auxiliary mainshaft reduction gear. Repeat the procedure for the tooth directly opposite the first one marked.
Stand the output shaft on a flat surface with the threaded end up.
Slide the flat washer onto the output shaft.
With the auxiliary mainshaft reduction gear clutching teeth down, slide the gear onto the output shaft.
With the smooth side up, slide the stepped washer onto the output shaft and against the reduction gear.

caution.para: Output bearing assemblies are matched sets. DO NOT mix bearing parts from one assembly with a different bearing assembly or the bearings will be damaged.
If using heat to install the bearings, do not heat bearings above 136°C or (275°F) or they will be damaged.

warning.para: Wear insulated gloves or similar protection to prevent possible burns when handling hot components.

step1.para: With tapered side up, use heat or an appropriate driver to install the output shaft bearing cone (with the long rollers) tightly against the stepped washer.
Place the bearing inner spacer on the output shaft.
